{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2011}} {{Infobox military person | name =Norris Leonard Einertson | image =NorrisEinertson.jpg | caption = Major General Norris Leonard Einertson
17th Chief of Chaplains of the United States Army | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=y|1930|8|6}} | death_date = | placeofburial_label = | placeofburial = | birth_place =[[Westbrook, Minnesota]] | death_place = | placeofburial_coordinates = | nickname = | allegiance = {{flag|United States of America}} | branch =[[File:United States Department of the Army Seal.svg|20px]] [[United States Army]] | serviceyears = 1961–1990 | rank =[[File:US-O8 insignia.svg|30px]] [[Major general (United States)|Major General]] | unit = | commands = [[Chaplain Corps (United States Army)|U.S. Army Chaplain Corps]] | battles = [[Vietnam War]] | awards = [[File:Distinguished Service Medal ribbon.svg|30px]] [[Distinguished Service Medal (U.S. Army)|Distinguished Service Medal]]
[[File:Legion of Merit ribbon.svg|30px]] [[Legion of Merit]]
[[File:Bronze Star ribbon.svg|30px]] [[Bronze Star Medal]]
[[File:Meritorious Service ribbon.svg|30px]] [[Meritorious Service Medal (United States)|Meritorious Service Medal]] | relations = | laterwork = }} Chaplain ([[Major general (United States)|Major General]]) '''Norris Leonard Einertson''', [[United States Army|USA]] (born August 6, 1930)Marquis Who's Who on the Web is a retired American Army officer who served as the 17th [[Chief of Chaplains of the United States Army]] from 1986 to 1990.{{Cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=h0sgAAAAIBAJ&sjid=5aYEAAAAIBAJ&pg=1349,4907165&dq=norris-einertson&hl=en|title=Military chaplains tread fine line between faith, might |publisher=Anchorage Daily News |date=December 10, 1988 |first=George W |last=Cornell }} ==Awards and decorations== {| |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=Distinguished Service Medal ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[Distinguished Service Medal (U.S. Army)|Distinguished Service Medal]] (with one bronze [[oak leaf cluster]]) |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=Legion of Merit ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[Legion of Merit]] |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=Bronze Star ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[Bronze Star]] |- |{{ribbon devices|number=2|type=oak|ribbon=Meritorious Service ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[Meritorious Service Medal (United States)|Meritorious Service Medal]] (with two bronze [[oak leaf clusters]]) |- |{{ribbon devices|number=1|type=oak|ribbon=Army Commendation Medal ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[Army Commendation Medal]] (with one bronze oak leaf cluster) |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=Vietnam gallantry cross unit award-3d.svg|width=60}} |[[Vietnam Gallantry Cross|Vietnam Gallantry Cross Unit Citation]] |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=VNCivilActionsRibbon-2.svg|width=60}} |[[Civil Actions Medal|Vietnam Civil Actions Unit Citation]] |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=National Defense Service Medal ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[National Defense Service Medal]] |- |{{ribbon devices|number=4|type=service-star|ribbon=Vietnam Service Ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[Vietnam Service Medal]] (with four bronze [[service stars]]) |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=ResMedRib.svg|width=60}} |[[Armed Forces Reserve Medal]] |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=Army Service Ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[Army Service Ribbon]] |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=Army Overseas Service Ribbon.svg|width=60}} |[[Overseas Service Ribbon]] |- |{{ribbon devices|number=0|type=oak|ribbon=Vietnam Campaign Medal Ribbon.png|width=60}} |[[Vietnam Campaign Medal]] |} ==Gallery== File:Norris Einertson.JPEG ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==Further reading== Zimmerman, Jr.]] |title = [[Chief of Chaplains of the United States Army]] |before = [[Patrick J. Hessian]] |years = 1986–1990}} {{s-end}} {{US Army navbox}} {{Current U.S. Military Chiefs of Chaplains}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Einertson, Norris L.}} [[Category:American military chaplains]] [[Category:United States Army generals]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War]] [[Category:Recipients of the Legion of Merit]] [[Category:Recipients of the Bronze Star Medal]] [[Category:1930 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chiefs of Chaplains of the United States Army]] [[Category:Vietnam War chaplains]] [[Category:Deputy Chiefs of Chaplains of the United States Army]] {{US-mil-bio-stub}}
